hotspots.name: Outside the Record House, Front Portico
hotspots.title: The Record House
hotspots.caption: Welcome to the Public Record Office of Ireland, which opened its doors in 1867.

hotspots.name: Stairwell
hotspots.title: The Stairwell
hotspots.caption: The rooms round this central hall [Search Room] were given up to searchers, officials and clerks, together with a library, whilst some of the top rooms and all the basement were allocated to the fore and and office keeper for a residence.'

hotspots.name: Stairwell
hotspots.title: The Search Room
hotspots.caption: Old Photo of Wood and Chart / Description of what it was like in 1922 / 3-D photo of modern Court of Appeal
hotspots.audio: The rooms round this central hall [Search Room] were given up to searchers, officials and clerks, together with a library, whilst some of the top rooms and all the basement were allocated to the fore and and office keeper for a residence.'

hotspots.name: Reading Room, Archivist's Desk
hotspots.title: The Archivist's Desk
hotspots.caption: Herbert Wood, Deputy Keeper of the Records in 1922, described the collection in his care as the 'great untilled field' of Irish history.

hotspots.name: Strong-Room
hotspots.title: The Strong Room
hotspots.caption: Some records survived the blaze because they wre held overnight in the Strong Room, which had iron bars across the windows for added security.

hotspots.name: Firebreak
hotspots.title: The Firebreak
hotspots.caption: An isolation space separated the Search Room from the Record Treasury. This worked as a firebreak and it saved the front of the building from destruction in 1922.

hotspots.title: The Record Treasury
hotspots.caption: This six-storey building held the accumulated public records dating back to 1174.

hotspots.name: Wood's Guide
hotspots.title: Herbert Wood's Guide to the Public Records (1919)
hotspots.caption: Wood's Guide

hotspots.title: Cross-Section of the Record Treasury
hotspots.caption: List of the 4 items that can be located

hotspots.name: Transport to Desk
hotspots.caption: Engage with materials: you will be able to search etc.

hotspots.name: Read Source 1
hotspots.title: PRONI, D 207/10/19. 'Observations on utility of Act of Union' by [Jn. Foster?], e.g.
hotspots.caption: c.1800. '[it] depends on the completion of the expected benefits expressed in Parliament previous to the passing that Act'. Reproduced courtesy of the Deputy Keeper of the Records and Viscount Massereene.
